Subject: Re: [junit] Adding a listener without using core?

In my ideal world I'd like to install a listener on any/all tests
being run.  Anything that makes that happen would be a good thing.  A
fairly simple fix would be to simply expose a static getter of a
JUnitCore object that represents the current run.  Despising statics
as we all do, a better fix would allow me to walk up the dynamic tree
and get the thing.

Hill


On Wed, Oct 8, 2008 at 1:49 PM, Joshua Kerievsky
<jlk@...> wrote:
> Hi David,
>
> Would there be a way to use a custom TestResult to make this work? We're
> ideally looking for a solution that also works with 3.8.x.
>
> best
> jk
